content:
I have an open PR with base branch master and head branch foo. I'd like to propose some changes to this initial PR. The obvious way to do this would be to open a second PR on the mathlib repo with base branch foo and head branch some new foo-alternative.

Is this The Mathlib Way, or should I instead open the second PR on my own fork and direct any potential reviewers there?
Yeah, sometimes we make such PRs that target another PR's branch for the purpose of suggesting larger changes during a review.
Nick Ward has marked this topic as resolved.
